Job Description & Summary

Genuine opportunities can be hard to spot. Unless you're someone who's used to finding needles in haystacks made of data. If you're one of those people, you also probably know that opportunities this good don't come along that often.

PwC is one of those places where opportunities create options.

We're a community of people united by the love of solving problems, and every solution we deliver cements trust with our clients.
And that trust creates more opportunities to strengthen our relationships and fortify our culture.

More than just a number

Supportive team leaders elevate your success.

We lead differently, empowering our people to harness their human ingenuity, passion and latest technology to create a better tomorrow.
We empower our people to use their creativity, authenticity and human differences to be the champions of change.

We know that when people from a variety of backgrounds and with different points of view work together, we create the most value - for our clients, our people and our society.
In Data Assurance, we care deeply about our people and the numbers. We celebrate having a culture where innovation meets passion. For us, it's about having an incredible team to solve important problems.

Feel confident in Assurance

What is assurance? A feeling of confidence.

It's what we strive to deliver to our clients as we work side by side to help solve the myriad of issues they face.
This assurance, in turn, enables organisations to build and earn trust with their stakeholders.

Data has changed the world. Our clients need trusted advice on how to best gather, use and analyse their information. That's where we come in.

We offer a wide range of services, from data governance and data quality to large scale recalculation, visualisation, data collection and validation platforms, as well as advanced analytics.
Our Data Assurance team works alongside clients in a multitude of ways. These may be complex recalculations of business process outcomes, developing bespoke solutions to specific problems.

We help transform external and internal audit approaches by embedding data analytics through the entire audit lifecycle and look to the future as algorithmic decisioning becomes embedded in operational areas.

We also help our clients establish the best controls, processes and structures to ensure that decisions are made on accurate information.

We often assure that information and data provided to regulators and third parties is accurate, complete and can be trusted.
About you

You have a background in data analytics. You're skilled in data visualisation, data cleansing and manipulation, and you understand business and risk applications. If you have any previous experience in internal audit analytics, that's a big green flag for us

As a Senior Associate in our Data Assurance team, you'll make an impact through:

Building risk and compliance data analytics outputs using tools like Alteryx, ACL, R, Python, Qlik Sense, Power BI, and SQL Server.

Applying risk and compliance analytics to drive decision making for our clients, helping them to better manage risks, optimise processes and build trust with their stakeholders.

Working across multiple client projects, with a broad range of tasks across the data analytics life cycle, like ETL, data wrangling and cleansing, reporting and dashboarding.
Compelling data-driven storytelling to communicate and help clients minimise risk and improve their processes and control framework.

Your New Benefits

Flexible daily working hours, we value work-life balance

Work overseas or interstate, we know how precious time is with your family and friends

Paid study (and leave), we pay all the costs and give you time off to study

No dress code, wear what makes you feel comfortable and dress for your day

Yearly bonuses, because who doesn't love to be rewarded for great performance

Health & fitness perks, like a wellness stipend and discounted memberships

Generous parental leave policy for mums, dads and foster carers

If you're looking for a team that values your work and solves meaningful problems, apply now

We believe the best work is human-led and tech-powered.

If you're keen to apply and need reasonable adjustments or would like to note which pronouns you use at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.
Maricruz Yangali is the Recruitment Manager for the role.

As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

You shall find the IDA team very self-motivated, high standard and forward thinking focused, and highly hands-on.

The role You'll be working under the Manager in Health Service Research, Analysis, and Modelling.

In this role, you'll use advanced data tools like Microsoft Azure, Power BI, Posit/R, Python, and SQL to make sure data flows smoothly between users and stakeholders.

Your job is to dig into big datasets, analyse data, and then share your findings in a way that makes sense.

You'll be a key part of making business intelligence products and improving the Planning Portal platform by adding up-to-date data, visuals, and dashboards.
This will make it easier for people to access health service planning information.

Additionally, your role will extend to fostering service planning capacity and capability across the Department of Health and Hospital and Health Services.

Your exceptional communication and people skills will enable you to diplomatically consult with a diverse range of stakeholders, fostering open and respectful dialogue while ensuring compliance with contemporary HR principles and practices.

The successful personTo thrive in this role, you need to know about the health system, including key health priorities, challenges, and the unique health needs of different groups of people.

You should also be really good at using Power BI or similar software to create visual representations of important health data.
In this job, you'll oversee building applications that show health information for the whole state to make decisions. It's important that you're skilled at getting and handling data from big datasets.

This means you should be great at analysing data and turning it into useful information that you can share with others.

You should also know how to use different tools for handling data, whether it's on a physical server or in the cloud.
Some of these tools include Azure, SQL Server, R Studio/Posit Workbench, Power BI, and Qlik.

It's crucial that you can look at numbers critically and turn them into useful insights that can be presented professionally.
Your job will also involve managing projects efficiently. This means you should be able to work well on your own and as part of a team.

You'll be responsible for making sure complex projects are completed on time and reach the goals that have been set.

Furthermore, your expertise should extend to utilizing both on-premises and cloud-based data integration tools, including Azure, SQL Server, R Studio/Posit Workbench, Power BI, and Qlik.
You should be adept at critically analysing numerical data, transforming it into insightful information, and presenting it professionally.

Additionally, your role will require efficient project management skills, highlighting your ability to work autonomously and collaboratively within a team, ensuring the successful management of complex, time-sensitive projects and meeting specified milestones.
About usThe Department of Health is responsible for the overall management of the public health system in Queensland.

We are an organisation that strongly believes in the need to collaborate with people who value the goals of our organisation and who will thrive in our workplace.
Working at the Department of Health is about making a difference.

Clinical Planning and Service Strategy (CPSS) is the division responsible for delivering clinical service strategy and planning, workforce strategy, planning, and leadership, mental health strategy and planning and precision medicine and research functions to improve health services available to the Queensland community, optimise health gains, reduce inequalities, and maximise the efficiency and effectiveness of the health system.

The Division collaborates with health system leaders, Hospital and Health Services, clinical networks, key healthcare service providers, research and academic organisations, State and Commonwealth agencies as well as non-government organisations and other divisions.
Benefits
• A fast-paced, challenging and supportive environment
• Competitive salary + generous superannuation and leave loading
• Flexible working arrangements
• Diverse work culture
• Career training and developmentTo apply for this exciting opportunity, please submit your resume and a cover letter (maximum two pages) outlining your skills and experience relevant for this role.

Job Description
Together, we open opportunities with our connected thinking.

Due to continued growth, Mott MacDonald’s leading Advisory team is looking for a Digital Analyst to be based in our Brisbane office. You will be joining a diverse team of consultants who are passionate about what they do, with proven track record of guiding our clients, and leading delivery of our state and country's most critical projects.
The opportunity

This role suits an early career professional looking to expand their experience by working on major QLD & ANZ projects. The role will focus on PowerBI/PowerApps, but over time will provide opportunities to work in other technologies such as Digital Engineering, ML/AL, GIS, and XR.
Your specific duties include:
• Provide Digital Analyst Liaise with internal clients to produce tools and platforms to enable them to efficiently deliver projects
• Help promote and enable the use of Digital Processes and tools in projects
• Produce Business Intelligence Dashboards from various data sources
• Work with clients to develop and support Digital solutions (this may be on site as required)
• Develop and maintain documentation for Digital solutions
• Support the wider business to develop and expand our digital services beyond our existing offering and help promote and enable the use of Digital Processes and tools in projects

Candidate Specification
You are a digital analyst with the hunger to expand your technical knowledge and learn new skills. Our team is looking for a skilled analyst who can showcase the following technical capabilities:
• Comfortable on Microsoft Power Platform
• Experience in designing, developing, and amending Power BI reporting tools for various user cases
• Understanding of SharePoint permissions and Azure security groups
• Knowledge of Python language
• Experience using GitHub would be and advantage but not necessary
Our company's values, culture, and benefits

We put equality, diversity, and inclusion at the heart of our organisation, seeking to promote fair employment procedures and practices to ensure equal opportunities for all, and where everyone can bring their full selves to work.

Mott MacDonald offers a range of competitive benefits and facilities to make this a great place to be, including:
• State-of-the-art office and end-of-trip facilities
• Agile working environment
• Competitive salary and group bonus incentive scheme
• Options to purchase additional annual leave
• Social events and company outings
You've got this!

This is an exciting time to join Mott MacDonald. We can provide you with significant opportunities for career development and the chance to experience challenging and rewarding

Job Profile
Mott MacDonald is a uniquely diverse global management, engineering and development consultancy that offers a diverse range of opportunities for potential employees to work with World Expert Practitioners on small and large scale projects within Australia and New Zealand.

Other Information
Equality, diversity and inclusion
We put equality, diversity and inclusion at the heart of our business, seeking to promote fair employment procedures and practices to ensure equal opportunities for all. We encourage individual expression in our workplace and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels they have the opportunity to contribute.

Agile working
At Mott MacDonald, we believe it makes business sense for you and your manager to choose how you can work most effectively to meet your client, team and personal commitments. We embrace agility, flexibility and trust.

Are you passionate about data analysis and intrigued by the world of gambling? Do you have a knack for uncovering valuable insights from intricate datasets? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you. We are searching for a Senior Data Analyst to join our clients dynamic team in Brisbane, Australia.

Our client is a pioneering and rapidly expanding gambling startup committed to providing innovative and responsible gaming experiences for users around the globe. Their team comprises talented individuals who share a passion for analytics, gambling, and data-driven decision-making.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of their gambling products. Your responsibilities will include analysing extensive datasets, identifying trends, and delivering actionable insights to enhance our product development and user engagement. Your work will directly influence their strategic decisions and contribute to the success of their gambling offerings.

Key Responsibilities:
• Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to define and refine data requirements.
• Devise and implement data collection strategies to capture pertinent gambling metrics.
• Analyse intricate datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and optimisation opportunities.
• Create compelling and informative reports and dashboards.
• Offer actionable recommendations for improving game design, user engagement, and monetisation.
• Conduct A/B tests and experiments to measure the impact of changes.
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and gambling analytics.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science).
• Proven experience as a data analyst, preferably within the gambling or gaming industry.
• Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
• Strong familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
• Experience with gambling analytics platforms is a plus.
• Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
• Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
• Enthusiasm for gambling and a solid understanding of gambling dynamics.

Description

About the role

Here at Karmo, we’re on a mission to evolve the way we access private transportation. We have established product lines, an existing and growing customer base, and are experiencing a sustained growth spurt which is driving us to build a larger business with a variety of alternatives to traditional car ownership, placing Karmo in a prime position within the burgeoning mobility-as-a-service (MaaS) industry in Australia.

We are looking for a Business Analyst with a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving skills, and a high attention to detail. As part of the role you will receive on-the-job training and you will be mentored and guided by the existing Product Management team. You will be working with the founding team and be part of the first 30 employees responsible for bringing the company’s vision to life by building bespoke systems that will take our company to the next level. As a profitable, funded startup, you will work directly with the CEO, COO, Product Management and Engineering teams on building our core software offerings. You will also work closely with our operations team, meet customers and suppliers, and generally be a key contributor in ensuring that we are building high-value, fit-for-purpose products.

Responsibilities
• Performing requirements analysis through discussions with SMEs and stakeholders across all levels within the business
• Validating business requirements and ensuring solutions meet business and customer’s needs and requirements
• Documenting business requirements through Jira user stories and in confluence
• Performing functional and usability tests of increments released by the scrum team
• Actively participating as an embedded member of the scrum team

Australian working rights only

If you don’t meet all the requirements, you are still welcome to reach out to discuss this opportunity in detail.

What you’ll do day to day
• Perform requirements analysis on upcoming features for our bespoke software products
• Create high-quality user stories based on requirements
• Work closely within the scrum team ensuring quality control is defined and conveyed prior to development commencing
• Perform quality assurance of released increments

Your first 30/60/90 days at Karmo

First 30 Days

Meet the team and learn the business

Start performing requirements analysis, creating user stories, performing quality control measures and quality assurance

Start embedding as a member of the scrum team

First 60 Days

Commence working on our product (more detail to be provided as part of the interview process)

First 90 Days

Commence shipping MVPs and internal tools (more detail to be provided as part of the interview process)

About you

You possess:
• Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail
• A can-do attitude and the ability to work autonomously while still being a team player. Good interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
• Experience in creating process flow diagrams
• Experience in conducting requirements validation and quality assurance of applications, websites, and SaaS products
• Experience using Jira and Confluence (preferred, but not required)
• Experience in Scrum (preferred, but not required)
• 2 years’ experience in a similar role (preferred, but not required)

Karmo Work Style

You can expect to work from our Brisbane office 3 days per week so we can conduct high bandwidth team meetings / strategy sessions / general work. However, you can work from home on days where face to face work is not required (note: to provide you with the best onboarding experience and set you up for success, you can expect to be in the office more frequently during your first 1-2 months).

What we offer

There is a lot to be inspired by here at Karmo - we’re leading the charge on vehicle access over ownership whilst pushing heavily towards EV and carbon neutral fleets. With flexible work arrangements and a collaborative approach to building software and systems from the ground up, there is heaps of scope for career development and professionally fulfilling experiences. This role in particular will be closely mentored by our Product Managers with daily exposure and hands-on experience in Product, User Experience, and Engineering.

In addition, you can expect your package to include:
• Competitive remuneration
• A flexible, hybrid work environment as detailed above
• Monthly Phone allowance
• Yearly wellbeing allowance
• Learning and development allowance

• Based in Milton, QLD

Downer's Road Services business is one of the largest non-government owned road services businesses in Australia. We operate from a network of over 50 depots and maintain more than 36,000 km of road.

An exciting career opportunity is available for Junior Machine Learning and Data Analyst to assist in the development and implementation of digital solutions including machine learning, artificial intelligence and MS Azure Power Platform for data collection, analysis and management.

ABOUT YOU
• An understanding of machine learning and object detection technologies with a desire to further develop in this area. Experience with Azure ML will be highly regarded.
• Degree qualified in computer science or equivalent tertiary qualification with quantitative research experience.
• A double degree with Civil Engineering is highly desired.
• Programming machine learning/artificial intelligence for data capture and / or optimisation.
• Sound knowledge of Python and SQL.
• Developing with Power Automate, Power Apps and Power BI.
• Preferable knowledge of road asset management concepts.
• Preferable 2 years of industry work experience.
• The ability to evaluate information quickly, identify key issues and formulate decisions.
• Well-developed communication skills with the ability to work collaboratively with all stakeholders including operational teams.
• Have a willingness and enthusiasm to learn road maintenance concepts and the application of workflow management systems.

WHAT WE OFFER
• Highly supportive, team-orientated organisation
• A strong commitment to Zero Harm environment for all our employees and visitors
• Competitive remuneration with on-going training and support
• A long-term career opportunity to work with an ASX listed company

At Downer, our approach to diversity is what sets us apart. Our people can be their best by bringing their most authentic selves to work every day. We are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role and your experience doesn’t align perfectly, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

To apply for this great opportunity, please click on "Apply" and submit your application. We do not accept applications via email but for more information, please contact:
Melissa Edwards – Talent and Sourcing Business Partner
P: 0418 261 964
E: Melissa.Edwards2@downergroup.com

Notwithstanding the location of this position, all qualified Australian citizens and permanent residents from all locations are encouraged to apply.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you

Ideal Candidate
• Fluent in English.
• Excellent research skills.
• Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
• Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Australia.
• Analytical mindset.

Job Requirements
• Must be living in Australia for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
• Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
• Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
• Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
• Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
• All work must be of an independent nature.

Technical requirements to perform the work

Access to a laptop or computer which uses:
- A logon account unique to you
- Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed
- Only one member per household may apply
NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.

Benefits

· Work up to 20 hours per week.
· Earn a competitive rate of pay.
· Develop your research skills.
· Avoid the long commute.
· Work from the comfort of your home office.
· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours

Apply Online Today

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

Working closely with the Manager, Business Intelligence and Customer Reporting (BICR), the program officer is responsible for supporting the business-as-usual activities of maintaining, developing and implementing various performance reporting methods and systems to monitor and project performance data pertaining to the topics of employment, small business and vocational education and training (VET).

The role requires a good skill set in the use of data collection, data management and data analysis technologies. As a member of the BICR team you will collaborate with fellow team members and clients at varying levels across the department to deliver data collection and reporting products that support the strategic direction of DESBT.

As Assistant Data Analyst, You Will Specifically

About the Company:

Major Australian not-for profit, looking for a Senior Data Analyst to support the business through a Government Reform project with data analysis, calculations, complex modelling, insights and advice. You will be responsible for gathering, analysing, and interpreting data from various sources, and utilising advanced statistical and analytical methods to uncover valuable insights and create solutions that support business objectives.

About the Role:

As a Senior Data Analyst, initially you role will focus on providing support for the Government Reform project, through developing complex financial and operational models to help determine the implications of the reform on the business, and to inform strategic decision making. In the long term, your role will transition to providing complex analysis and insights to solve various business problems, including delving into blue sky problems.

Key Responsibilities:
• Collect, analyse and interpret data from various sources, using advanced statistical and analytical methods
• Develop and implement data analysis systems and applications, using tools such as SQL, Python, R, PowerBI
• Provide specialist data analysis skills to uncover insights and develop solutions to support business goals
• Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders and senior management, using clear and compelling visualisations and reports
• Apply mathematical, statistical, and other advanced analytical techniques to solve complex business problems and generate actionable insights.
• Create dashboards, reports, presentations, and other deliverables to communicate analysis results and recommendations to stakeholders and senior management
About You:
• 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, ideally in a large business or Government
• Proficient in SQL and at least one programming language such as Python or R
• Experience in financial modelling, predictive analytics, and complex business models
• Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills
For more information on this opportunity please contact Olivia at BLACKROC for a confidential chat on 0468 918 176. Alternatively, if this isn’t the right opportunity for you but you’re interested in other opportunities in Brisbane, feel free to reach out. olivia@blackroc.co

Randstad Data is currently working with the Federal Government to find a number of Data Scientists to join a high performing team across Australia. These are permanent positions, based in Brisbane’s CBD.

The Role

As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for analysing high volumes of unstructured and structured data and applying advanced data science techniques to extract valuable insights and you may develop junior staff in their capabilities at the EL1 and 2 levels. Conducting and developing highly specialised analytic solutions by utilising various statistical, machine learning and computational methods.

About the role:

The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.

The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.

Duties:
• Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation.
• Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners.
• Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development.
• Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques.
• Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.

Required experience/skills:
• Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality.
• Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
• Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders
• Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.

Desirable experience skills:
• Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design.
• Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data.
• Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields.
• Experience operating in a policy environment.

ICT Contractor Position Description

POSITION TITLE:

Senior Data Analyst

LOCATION:

111 George Street, Brisbane

CLOSING DATE:

COB Friday, 4 November 2022

HIRING MANAGER:

Tania Vicary

Director

Department overview

The Department of Children, Youth Justice and Multicultural Affairs (CYJMA) recognise Queensland comprises communities of diverse cultural backgrounds who have varying needs and aspirations, and who rely on diverse industries for their livelihoods.

In response to this, the Department works in partnership across government, with local communities, non-government organisations and the private sector to achieve the best outcomes for Queenslanders.

By working with us, you will have the opportunity to work with staff from across the department to resolve complex issues and change life trajectories.

About Unify

CYJMA has commenced a four-year journey to implement a new contemporary and coordinated case management system for vulnerable children, young people and families. The Unify Program has been established to deliver this new system to support current and future child safety and youth justice needs through adaptable technology that can support changes to practice as reform occurs over time.

The program will be comprised of a series of joined up projects to provide new integrated and innovative legislation, practice and performance frameworks and business processes, enabled by technology and underpinned by a human-centered design approach.

The program focuses on three critical capabilities:
• It is client-centric: supporting targeted, needs-based responses to children, young people, parents, families, carers and communities while delivering earlier and more effective interventions.
• It is integration-enabling: designed around collaboration and information sharing, enabling connected and integrated responses to clients across government agencies and non-government partners.
• It is data driven, enabling the effective monitoring of outcomes to improve the experiences of children, young people and families and ensures that future investment is directed to what works.

Purpose of the position

The purpose of this position is to provide high quality data analysis, mapping and modelling to the Unify program for the delivery of Child and Family and Youth Justice Products.

The position will be required to engage and work closely with a range of stakeholders to analyse data needs, gather and document requirements, and develop artefacts. The position will play a critical role in understanding the data required for migration, cleansing, viewing and ultimately reporting. In this role one has to work very closely with transactional systems business analysts to build logical/physical data models for the department’s business processes and manage common data model that satisfies requirements.

The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate the capacity to work within a multi-specialist team and deliver to tight timeframes and deadlines (and rapidly changing priorities).

Key responsibilities
• Undertake data mapping against an ICT solution and identify the delivery of data sets to support Product delivery
• Understand business needs and processes to identify, analyse and document detailed data requirements
• Work with business representatives to determine priorities and validate and justify the requirements
• Participate in data extract, transformation and migration activities
• Work with development teams and other skilled analysts to validate functionality against the data requirements
• Provide timely, strategic and expert advice regarding data requirements, information requirements, business impacts, scope management, and project risks
• Manage the delivery of work to a schedule and assist in the setting and managing of expectations
• Use high level communication skills to negotiate, establish, and maintain networks and working relationships
• Apply standardised templates, methodologies and processes for data analysis activities and related project documentation
• Lead and work collaboratively with a wide range of staff at all levels
• Contribute to business integration, change management, and testing activities
• Actively manage a working environment supporting quality human resource management practices including employment equity, anti-discrimination, occupational health and safety, and ethical behaviour.

Essential requirements

The applicant must demonstrate:
• Demonstrated experience in data ingestion, cleansing, manipulation and modelling.
• Experience in eliciting, analysing, specifying, documenting and validating the business data needs of stakeholders.
• Data/reports development skills and experience relevant to the position
• Understanding and experience working with applications that utilise complex relational architecture
• Experience working within a large, complex multi-disciplinary organisation
• High level of written communication and documentation skills
• Proven effective communication and stakeholder engagement skills and experience
• Proven ability to manage a large workload whilst maintaining high levels of accuracy

Desirable requirements
• Data and ETL experience especially with Microsoft Azure Cloud Data Platform (Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Profisee, Azure Data Verse)
• Ability to write complex SQL scripts, queries, and stored procedures to extract and mine data.
• Experience in developing complex reports, including consideration of complex business rules and data architecture
• Knowledge and understanding of the public sector Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Environment.
• See projects through to completion, monitoring project progress and adjusting plans as required.
• Take personal responsibility for meeting objectives and progressing work. Demonstrate initiative and proactively steps in and does what is required. Commits energy and drive to see that goals are achieved.
• Consults and shares information and ensures others are kept informed of issues.
• Experience in agile projects methodology.

Deliverables
• Document business data requirements and entity relationship at logical and physical levels and maintenance for business products
• Develop a data dictionary, detailed data flow diagrams, specifications, and other project related artefacts and documentation as required by the project/program management leadership team.
• Document and implement work package activities
• Assist stakeholders with User Acceptance Testing

About Us:

At Auto & General (A&G), we provide great products and services to safeguard our customers in their time of need. Our range of general insurance products protects customers on the road, at home and on holiday with various Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents, and Pet products as well as Roadside Assistance.

Our culture of ‘high performance with high integrity’ underpins our values and the way we interact with our customers, the community and each other. We’re excited about the future and we’re always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia’s best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.

The Role

The Pricing Data Scientist will be responsible for undertaking advanced analytics and data science services to support the Pricing Team. This includes developing and implementing best practice predictive models, exploring the use of new or existing data assets, and providing expert support on process improvements. You will also need to provide advice and report on the impact of key Pricing decisions and operational activities on the portfolio.

To be successful in this role, the Pricing Data Scientist should have an appreciation of traditional Pricing approaches and understand the strengths and weaknesses of alternative approaches. They should be able to demonstrate an innovative approach to problem-solving and possess excellent communication skills that target a non-technical audience.

Accountabilities
• Manage the end-to-end development and implementation of a range of predictive models that support the business to make better decisions.
• Review the modelling process including data preparation, modelling, review, implementation and monitoring as well as make recommendations for continuous improvements.
• Support the Actuarial Team’s approach to technical pricing by developing approaches for more efficient processing of external data, classification of assets or use of available information.
• Evaluate and manage complex changes to models and their implications.
• Create test plans, manage and sign-off testing for all business-wide IT changes that impact pricing.

Knowledge And Experience
• 5+ years general insurance industry experience.
• Experience with developing and implementing a range of predictive models for various purposes.
• Proven analytical and problem-solving capability.
• Clear understanding of statistical modelling techniques and, in particular, modern modelling techniques (e.g. machine learning).
• Superior communication skills that include stakeholder management and development of high-quality board papers.
• Familiarity with statistical software packages (e.g. SAS, R, SQL) is advantageous.
• Degree qualified in mathematics, statistics, actuarial studies or similar.

Our Perks

• Extra leave - Enjoy additional leave days on us! You’ll receive a paid ‘ME’ day and one paid volunteer leave day annually. Team members can also purchase up to two additional weeks of leave per year.
• Paid parental leave - We support our new parents with paid parental leave and other benefits.
• Workplace giving - If you’re passionate about a cause, then we are too – we offer workplace giving and we’ll dollar-match your donations to registered charities.
• Development opportunities - We’re championing your development with internal programs and access to a wide range of online courses.
• Employee discounts - You’ll receive discounts on Budget Direct insurance products.
• Reward and recognition - We reward high performance with employee recognition, reward and incentive schemes.
• Onsite facilities – There are excellent end-of-trip facilities on offer and private spaces for nursing mothers.
• Get social - Join our vibrant social and community activities including annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events across each of our sites.
• Perks App - Access to an employee benefits and discounts app called ‘Perks’ offering your great discounts, offers and programs across a range of areas.

• Seeking a Data & Insights Analyst for Fundraising & Marketing
• Salary: $90K - $100K + Super + Salary packing
• Location: Melbourne, Sydney or remote
• Opportunities to continually advance your Data Analytics career.

We are seeking candidates with a strong background in proven data and data insights expertise. This role goes beyond merely aggregating data into basic tabular reports; it involves the ability to comprehend and present insights in a compelling manner.

These insights will not only significantly impact the donor experience but also go beyond seeking new financial opportunities. We are looking for individuals who are actively dedicated to enhancing our business offerings.

About the role

In this role, you will be tasked with pioneering innovative approaches to harness consumer behavioural data. Your goal is to derive descriptive and prescriptive insights that will guide optimal decision-making. Additionally, you will be responsible for creating interactive and automated dashboards that empower our fundraising team to make strategic decisions through proactive in-depth analysis and insights.

Key responsibilities
• Build and Provide insights for the individual giving team in fundraising.
• Develop subject matter expertise in the various channels used by the individual giving team.
• Engage with business users to consult and recommend best possible way to answer their business data questions.
• Provide rapid answers to business questions using a mix of queries and visualisations.
• Support ad hoc data requests from across business areas.
• Design and build reporting data models that support user self-serve reporting.
• Identify data to integrate with the warehouse to develop actionable insights to drive business decisions.
• Build customer segmentation analytics and campaign performance reporting.
• Proactively organising training and development activities for business to facilitate adaption.
• Design, build, test and present meaningful insights from a complex range of data.

Skills and experience
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, economics, or a related field.
• 3-5 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or related field.
• 1-2 years’ experience working with fundraising teams
• Experience with data visualisation and querying tools such as Power BI and SQL.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Knowledge of data modelling, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
• Strong ability to work in T-SQL and DAX queries.
• Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
• Experience in developing and maintaining reports, dashboards, and visualisations.
• Knowledge of fundraising and marketing analytics and metrics.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
• Strong attention to detail and accuracy.

More about the role

Furthermore, you will play a vital role in supporting the enhancement of consumer engagement strategies and product-specific initiatives. Leveraging technical solutions and advanced analytics, you will be at the forefront of developing ground breaking solutions for consumer profiling and segmentation.

Through your work in extracting insights from diverse data sources, you will drive strategic and operational initiatives. These initiatives will lead to increased revenue, improved efficiency, cost optimisation, and an elevated supporter experience, ultimately contributing to the organisation's success and sustainable growth.

A little about our client

Mission Australia, a renowned national charity with over 160 years of dedicated service, is on a mission to help vulnerable Australians find their path to independence. They are committed to tackling homelessness, supporting struggling families, addressing mental health challenges, and fighting substance dependencies. Mission Australia thrives on the support of everyday Australians, corporate partners, and a passionate team of professionals.

Next step is to APPLY

Ready to embark on an epic journey where your data skills make a real difference?

Send us your application, including a cover letter and resume, send it through Beaumont People now! Join Mission Australia and become a data wizard on a mission to end homelessness and help communities thrive!

Apply now and be part of something truly magical!

Don’t tick all the boxes? That’s okay, we like thinking outside the box. We value skills, passion, and drive. So, if this job resonates with you, we want to hear from you!

If you would like to have a confidential chat, please contact Jack or Dean on 02 9133 9322 or email dean@beaumontpeople.com.au, using the subject line: Data Insights Analyst - Mission Australia enquiry via EthicalJobs.

Beaumont People believe a diverse workplace is a happy workplace, and we love working with organisations that feel the same way. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital or parental status. About This Opportunity

The Data Analyst is responsible for analysing data sourced by and on behalf of the Student Affairs Division from across the University, in order to respond to the day-to-day needs of various areas of the Division. This position will undertake analysis to identify trends and opportunities for growth to support the student experience and will play a lead role in the development of annual divisional reporting.

• Undertaking analysis of data sets to provide well-informed briefings and reports, identifying trends and opportunities for service delivery improvements.
• Streamlining data reporting ensuring that it meets the needs of Student Affairs and wider University stakeholders.
• Maintaining awareness of relevant technology and software improvements that may benefit the collection, integration, presentation, and analysis of data within UQ to support programs and initiatives that enhance the student experience.

This is a full-time, continuing (permanent) position.

At HEW level 7, the full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $93,254 to $101,680, plus a generous super allowance of up to 17%. The total FTE package will be up to $109,107 to $118,966 annually.

About You

• Demonstrated ability to compile and manipulate complex data sets and proven analytical skills with the ability to leverage quantitative/qualitative trend data to draw conclusions related to the student experience provided by the division.
• Excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to design and produce clear, concise, and accurate advice and briefing papers on complex issues. A proven ability to be highly organised and self-managing, including a demonstrated capacity to establish work priorities, meet timelines and achieve project management priorities, work independently and accept responsibility.

In our team you will :

data.job_title: Data Analyst - Australian and New Zealand Congenital Outcomes for Surgery (ANZCORS)
data.job_description:
Are you passionate about outcomes for children and young people across Queensland?

We're committed to providing life-changing healthcare for children and young people for a healthier tomorrow.

About the Queensland Children's Hospital

The Queensland Children's Hospital (QCH), which opened on 29 November 2014, is Australia's largest and most advanced paediatric facility. Located in South Brisbane, the 359-bed hospital features more than 80,000 square meters of facilities spread across 12 levels.

As Queensland's single specialist paediatric facility, Children's Health Queensland's (CHQ) at the QCH is the hub of a dedicated network of paediatric services available at other Brisbane and Queensland hospitals. Expanding on CHQ's state-wide remit, the QCH also supports regional hospitals through telemedicine and outreach services. This means children and young people can access the services they need as close to home as possible.

The hospital precinct includes the Centre for Children's Health Research, the Children's Hospital Foundation, Ronald McDonald House South Brisbane (opened in 2016) and a new Adolescent Drug and Alcohol Withdrawal Service building.

Your Opportunity:
• Manage a binational team of data managers and biostatisticians for a binational registry, the “Australia and New Zealand Congenital Outcome Registry for Surgery” designed to evaluate outcomes following paediatric cardiac surgery across Australia and New Zealand
• Coordinate data collection, data validation and secure transmission for the dataset across all participating sites.
• Manage, extract and prepare data for analysis for annual registry reports and regulatory requirements as well as publications.
• Work with collaborators to establish clear data definitions and site-specific processes to ensure quality data is collected and transmitted.

What CHQ HHS can offer

Apart from contributing to the development of Australia's best paediatric health service, you will also benefit from a competitive remuneration package and a working environment which embraces professional development, builds capabilities and supports staff to maximise their health and wellbeing. Additional benefits include:
• Up to 12.75% employer superannuation contribution
• 17.5% annual leave loading
• Salary packaging
• Employee Assistance Program
• Work/life balance, variety and flexibility

You can find out more about why it's so great to work at CHQ HHS here ( http://www.childrens.health.qld.gov.au/work-for-us/ ).

It is a mandatory condition of employment for this role to be:
• vaccinated against, and remain vaccinated against, certain vaccine preventable diseases (VPD) as outlined in the Health Employment Directive NO. 01/16(PDF) ( https://www.health.qld.gov.au/__data/assets/pdf_file/0009/150120/hed-0116.pdf )
• Vaccinated against COVID-19 as outlined in the Health Employment Directive NO. 12/21(PDF) ( https://www.health.qld.gov.au/__data/assets/pdf_file/0022/1108453/hed-1221.pdf ) and the Queensland Health Human Resources Policy B70(PDF) ( https://www.health.qld.gov.au/__data/assets/pdf_file/0024/1108446/qh-pol-486.pdf ).

Business Intelligence Analyst

The Reporting and Business Partnering team is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join the team and assist in building out the function and capability, including but not limited to digital automation and process improvement.

Your New Opportunity

We are in search of a skilled Business Intelligence Analyst to join our finance team, with a primary focus on automating existing reporting processes and expanding the internal analytics capability across our professional services firm. You will play a pivotal role in creating insightful reports that offer valuable insights to Partners and Managers, specifically related to profitability, clients, our people, and operations.

Responsibilities:
• Collaborate closely with the Finance Manager - Business Partnering and Reporting, to understand technical reporting requirements and translate them into effective data models and PowerBI dashboards.
• Implement ETL processes to gather, transform, and load data from different systems into a central data repository, simplifying report creation.
• Utilise your technical expertise to create visually appealing and interactive reports and dashboards that align with design requirements to provide meaningful insights.
• Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for process improvements, supporting informed decision-making.
• Help develop and nurture a roadmap for transitioning from prescriptive analytics to predictive analytics capabilities, in alignment with the firm's strategic goals.
• Collaborate with the IT infrastructure team to ensure data models and reports are deployed appropriately at enterprise level, whilst adhering to data governance best practices and prioritising data security.
• Support the integration of Power Apps to automate manual finance processes and enhance efficiency across the finance team.
• Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data warehousing and Power BI technologies, implementing best practices to continuously enhance technical delivery capabilities.

Skills and Key Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analytics or a related field.
• Strong knowledge of data warehousing concepts, database design, and ETL processes.
• Expertise in building data models, Power BI reports, and interactive dashboards using SQL, DAX, Power Query, or M Query.
• Demonstrated experience in integrating data from multiple sources and designing data pipelines for optimal performance.
• Prior experience or familiarity with financial reporting requirements within a professional services firm is desirable.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
• Eagerness to stay adaptable and embrace new methodologies as we expand our analytics capabilities.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate and present technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders.

Why BDO?

BDO offers professional development, collaborative culture, workplace flexibility, global career growth opportunities and an industry-competitive salary package.

We are committed to building your technical, advisory, leadership, and management skills, and balance work with promoting health, wellbeing, workplace giving and social activities. At BDO, we want you to enjoy what you do and the community of colleagues and clients you work with.

As a firm, we embrace an inclusive culture and value the difference and unique perspective of every individual. We are proud to be named an Inclusive Employer by Diversity Council Australia (DCA).

To submit your application please click Apply Now or for further information please contact Brett Beauchamp at Learn more what we offer at BDO.

Energy Queensland (EQL) has two permanent opportunities for two Asset Maintenance Specialists focusing primarily on Data Analytics as part of the Transformer & Reactive Plant and Secondary Plant & Auxiliary Systems department located at either Rockhampton, Townsville, Toowoomba, Brisbane (Newstead). Both EQL and external candidates can apply.

About your new role:

As a data analytics professional at EQL, you will provide systematic advice on network asset performance. Your key responsibilities include monitoring and analysing asset performance and maintenance, planning program performance, and reporting findings and corrective actions to relevant parties.

You will also perform periodic asset performance analysis, maintain documentation, handle asset failure data requests, and ensure regulatory compliance. Identifying developing trends and engineering strategies will be critical to your success.

Why choose to work for us?

It’s an exciting time to join us and to be involved in the energy sector, so consider us for your next career move, where you will experience:
• Secure employment backed by a strong collective agreement, with yearly EBA increases.
• Strong 12.75% superannuation and the ability to earn more with salary sacrifice co- contributions.
• Opportunities for skills and career advancement with access to ongoing training and leadership programs and the capacity to build and grow your skills.
• Healthy work life balance with the option to WFH, two days per week and ad hoc as required.
• A chance to give back with a paid employee volunteering program allowing our employees to support communities across QLD.
• Support and guidance with access to a 24/7 Employee Assistance Program and a mentoring program for professional support and guidance.
• A Safety-First culture, the safety of our people, customers & communities is a core priority.
• Reward and recognition with an internal reward and recognition program that includes an annual celebration of excellence.
• Diversity and Inclusion where all employees can contribute towards multiple diversity and inclusion initiatives across our business.
• Grow professionally with full access to LinkedIn Learning.
• Need wheels? Options available for novated leases for personal use.

About you:

You have a degree or equivalent experience in data science, business, or mathematics. You have demonstrated experience in line and substation maintenance practices. You have strong communication skills, work well in teams, and prioritise tasks.

You have demonstrated experience using SAP and Ellipse applications. You are highly proficient in programming languages such as Python or R. You are also willing to learn and have excellent problem-solving skills to approach business problems as data science tasks.

The job may require travel and non-standard working hours.

About us:

Even if you haven’t heard of Energy Queensland you might know our operational brands - Energex, Ergon Energy Network, Ergon Energy Retail and Yurika. As a group, we are growing rapidly and as part of the Queensland Energy and Jobs Plan (QEJP), actively helping to advance the energy transition towards net zero.

Energy Queensland is the group of electricity distribution, retail, and energy services businesses 100% owned by the state of Queensland. We deliver electricity across Queensland through our ‘poles and wires’ businesses Energex and Ergon Energy Network. Our retailer, Ergon Energy Retail sells this electricity to customers throughout regional Queensland. And these essential service activities are supported by a range of innovative products and services delivered through our Yurika brand.

Across Australia and New Zealand our geospatial capability continues to grow.

Brief Description

About us

At Auto & General (A&G), we provide great products and services to safeguard our customers in their time of need. Our range of general insurance products protect customers on the road, at home and on holiday with various Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents, Pet products as well as Roadside Assistance.

Our culture of ‘high performance with high integrity’ underpins our values and the way we interact with our customers, the community and each other. We’re excited about the future and we’re always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia’s best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.

Purpose of the Role

The Reporting Analyst – Claims and Assessing will help to inform and support key performance objectives across the Claims and Assessing Division and Corporate Finance by providing insights and clarity.

Position Accountabilities

The Reporting Analyst – Claims and Assessing works within the defined procedures of the Corporate Finance team to improve visibility and insights on operational and finance data.
• Help to provide clarity between operational measures and metrics and financial data.
• Enhance existing reporting by adding further insights and commentary.
• Work with the Claims and Assessing Division to ensure operational reporting includes relevant financial measures and metrics.
• Adhoc reporting and data requests for the Corporate Finance divisions.

• Support the Finance Business Partnering team with planning and forecasting as required.
• Take all reasonable directions from leaders to comply with the organisation’s workplace health & safety (WHS) protocols. WHS is everyone’s responsibility.

Qualifications And Experience
• 2 years experience in an analytical role in a comparable organization environment.
• An ability to understand and draw insights from complex data.

• An ability to work across the organization with stakeholders from different divisions
• Written and verbal communication including developing requirements, solution and process documentation, facilitating meetings, building relationships and interacting with stakeholders within all levels of A&G

Our Perks

• Paid parental leave - We support our new parents with paid parental leave and other benefits.
• Workplace giving - If you’re passionate about a cause, then we are too – we offer workplace giving and we’ll dollar match your donations to registered charities.

• Get social - Join our vibrant social and community activities including annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events across each of our sites.

data.job_description:
Volunteer Data Analytics and Software Developer

Salary: Volunteer

Hours: Minimum fifteen hours weekly

Contract: Minimum six-month commitment

Location: Brisbane, Australia. Remote candidates are welcome to apply.

Why join THRIVE?

Looking for a role where you can be part of a collaborative, mission-led group? Hoping to build a network of global contacts and develop your teamwork skills?

When you become a volunteer at THRIVE, you’ll receive:
• Free induction, training, and mentorship sessions
• The opportunity to develop your presentation skills
• Access to global connections (including VIPs)
• Guidance and education from experienced volunteers
• The chance to land a paid job

What is THRIVE?

THRIVE stands for The Holistic Regenerative Innovative Value Entity. As a not-for-profit for-impact initiative, we aim to place humankind on a more sustainable path and create a ‘thrivable’ future for all.

The THRIVE Platform is a free, web-based tool that uses the best-available science to address contemporary global challenges. The THRIVE platform uses machine learning to help guide countries, cities, companies, and individuals on their journey towards a more sustainable future.

THRIVE has excellent relationships with a variety of research groups, educational bodies, and UN-affiliated policymakers.

We use educational content and free software solutions to address some of the following global challenges:
• Climate change
• Loss of biodiversity
• Deforestation
• Social inequality
• Pollution

By joining THRIVE, you will help to ensure humanity can face global issues effectively and sustainably.

The Role

We’re looking for a motivated, enthusiastic Data Analytics and Software Developer to join our friendly, global team.

Your experience will include:
• Working with google ecosystem, including studio, sheets, apps (similar to js), and SQL
• Identifying data sources, consolidating datasets, turning them into insights
• Analysing data to find answers to specific questions
• Developing and implementing SQL based queries on our existing datasets
• Generating insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns
• Preparing reports for project teams and the organisation including visualisations and storytelling

In this volunteer role, you'll learn how to develop your cloud knowledge, work in teams, and provide actionable insights, working amongst a dynamic international team who is informing and changing the world for the better.

Position Requirements
• Bachelor's degree
• Fluent in English (preferred)
• A passion for sustainability
• A collaborative team player mindset
• Excellent communication and organization skills
• Experience working in a fast-paced environment
• Well-developed problem-solving abilities
• Highly organized
• The ability to handle multiple tasks to meet strict deadlines
• Exceptional time management skills
• Ambition and proactivity

At THRIVE, we’re looking for individuals who strongly align with our mission and vision for a thrivable future. If you’re looking for an opportunity to join a growing initiative that allows you to gain valuable experience while giving back to a worthy cause, apply now.

We’re strongly committed to equal opportunities and value diversity in our workforce.

Applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

Together, we can do great things

Our sustainable returns from investments come from focusing on what matters most to customers — a great experience and doing good. Every day, our people are driving positive impact for people, place and planet. They’re inquisitive, pioneering industry firsts and pushing new ideas to deliver exceptional outcomes.

This passion and expertise create an employee experience that puts wellbeing, flexibility and opportunity first.

Come join us.

The role

We have an new opportunity for a Business Analyst (6 month fixed term) to join the team supporting the delivery and optimisation of finance technology products.

As Business Analyst, you will work collaboratively with developers and business subject matter experts on the development, management and maintenance of these products, primarily involving Anaplan.

You will also support critical testing work on a project involving financial forecasting alongside the project lead.

This is a rare contract opportunity to gain valuable exposure to working with a top ASX50 property company with strong resourcing, systems and processes.

• Working consultatively with business teams to understand requirements, requests, issues about the system/application

• Creating documentation including user stories, process maps, testing and acceptance criteria
• Assisting with relevant system training and communication to the business
• Working with and as a tester on project work which may involve writing test scripts, user story writing and documentation

What makes you stand out

We are looking for highly motivated and adaptable Business Analyst with experience in delivering technology related projects and knowledge of common agile product management, wireframing, testing and analytics tools (including JIRA).

You will be experienced in testing software applications with a sound working knowledge of finance products.

You would ideally have working experience with Anaplan and developing UI/UX solutions within a product management or an enterprise architecture environment.

Importantly, you will be a skilled communicator, able to influence, educate and build rapport with all stakeholders to be successful in the role.

What makes us stand out

We value our people

Everyone counts

As an equal employer, we encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, cultures, sexual orientations and gender identities. This includes Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQIA+ community, and people living with disabilities.

Let’s get started

If this sounds like you then we want to hear from you! Click on “Apply” to submit your formal application and Sherene from the Talent Acquisition Team will be in touch.

The Role

Deal Desk Analyst

LOCATION: Remote, Australia

POSITION SUMMARY

As part of the Bentley Deal Desk and reporting to the Manager, Deal Desk, the Deal Desk Analyst is focused on performing data analysis on—often irregular—accounts and opportunities. Working with Regional Directors and Account Managers, the Analyst develops offers, applying standardized commercial models and providing deal guidance regarding variations from standard. Ensures offers meet Bentley requirements and drive ARR growth.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Specializes in performing the data analysis
• Conducts exploratory analyses to understand account usage and behavior patterns
• Analyzes data from large disparate data sets, queries, and reports present in operational and financial systems and assigning context to business data

• Address governance requirements of stakeholders outside of Account Advancement (e.g., Financial Operations, Contracts, Legal)
• Develop complex deal propositions
• Implement methods and systems to increase individual and team efficiencies
• Ensure Deal Desk products (e.g., advice, escalations/approvals, and program/campaign designs), are comprehensive
• Ensure offers are executable by Financial Operations, Finance, Legal, and other accountable stakeholders, in accordance with defined programs and managing associated levels of discretion

ACCOUNTABILITY
• Ensure commercial integrity (e.g., profitability, soundness of proposed variations from Commercial Programs' standard) of each assigned deal
• Document deal parameters in Deal Desk systems (e.g., SharePoint, C4S)
• Drive measurable increases in ARR, from deal intake through stakeholder approval
• Convey financial impacts of recommendations; ensure full disclosure and reportability of specific deal outcomes

QUALIFICATIONS
• Extremely effective communicator with exceptional presentation skills; capable of interacting with colleagues at every level and across every business line, enhancing process engagement from stakeholders

• This role does not require travel.
